summary: Wombats are unique animals native to Australia. They are short and muscular, with strong legs and small tails. These marsupials grow up to 40 inches long and weigh between 44 to 77 pounds. Wombats are versatile and can live in various habitats, from forests to mountains and heathlands. They are mainly found in southern and eastern Australia, including Tasmania, and a small area in central Queensland.
title: Wombat
